text: {| |} Fame was built by Matthew Smith at Calcutta in 1803. In 1803 her managing owners were Archer and Smith. On 27 July 1807 Fame was lost on the Eastern Sea Reef. Captain Joseph Latour and all aboard took to her boats and were saved.Asiatic annual register or a view of the history of Hindustan and of the politics, commerce and literature of Asia, Vol 10, pp.6-8. ==Citations and references== Citations References * * Category:1803 ships Category:British ships built in India Category:Age of Sail merchant ships of England Category:Maritime incidents in 1807 Category:Shipwrecks
title: Fame (1803 ship)
